001package net.tvburger.jdl.linear.basis;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.List;
008
009@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
010public class PolynomialFunction<N extends Number> implements BasisFunction<N> {
011
012    private final int m;
013    private final JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport;
014
015    public PolynomialFunction(int m, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
016        this.m = m;
017        this.typeSupport = typeSupport;
018    }
019
020    @Override
021    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getCurrentNumberType() {
022        return typeSupport;
023    }
024
025    @Override
026    public N apply(N input) {
027        N power = typeSupport.one();
028        for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
029            power = typeSupport.multiply(power, input);
030        }
031        return power;
032    }
033
034    public static class Generator<N extends Number> implements BasisFunction.Generator<N> {
035
036        private final JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport;
037
038        public Generator(JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
039            this.typeSupport = typeSupport;
040        }
041
042        @Override
043        public FeatureExtractor<N> generate(int featureCount) {
044            List<BasisFunction<N>> polynomials = new ArrayList<>(featureCount);
045            for (int i = 0; i < featureCount; i++) {
046                polynomials.add(new PolynomialFunction<>(i + 1, typeSupport));
047            }
048            return new FeatureExtractor<>(polynomials, typeSupport);
049        }
050
051        @Override
052        public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getCurrentNumberType() {
053            return typeSupport;
054        }
055
056    }
057}
